definition: This version of the ?? Folded Hands emoji has the ?? Medium-light Skin Tone applied, which is displayed as a Cream White Skin Tone on suppor http://emojipedia.org/person-with-folded-hands-type-3/
name: folded hands: medium-light skin tone

bn:00104250a: Belonging to or derived from or associated with a divine power

bn:00099415a: Relating to the sky or heavens.
Relating to or inhabiting a divine heaven
Relating to the sky or space.
Of or pertaining to the heavens or sky, regarded as the realm of the sun, moon, planets and stars.

bn:00091743v: To enter a plea, as in courts of law.
Enter a plea, as in courts of law

bn:00083331v: To call upon or pray to earnestly; to entreat.
To ask earnestly for; to seek to obtain by supplication; to entreat for.
To make a request in a humble manner; to call upon in supplication.

bn:00091742v: Offer as an excuse or plea
To offer as an excuse or plea.

bn:00088854v: Express gratitude or show appreciation to
To express gratitude or appreciation to someone.
Express gratitude or appreciation to someone.

bn:00091921v: To address God or a higher being with praise, thanksgiving, confession or supplication.
Address a deity, a prophet, a saint or an object of worship; say a prayer

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:00029734n: Heaven, the heavens or seven heavens, is a common religious, cosmological, or transcendent place where heavenly beings such as gods, angels, jinn, saints, or venerated ancestors originate, are enthroned, or live.
Any place of complete bliss and delight and peace
A place of complete bliss, delight, and peace; paradise.

Heaven may refer to the physical heavens, the sky, the seemingly endless expanse of the universe beyond, or to otherworldly realms, often in an "afterlife plane" of existence, attested to in various religions or spiritual philosophies.

bn:00080435n: A desire, hope, or longing for something or for something to happen
The state of wanting something; desire.
The idea of want can be examined from many perspectives.

bn:00076768n: Used to express appreciation or gratitude.

bn:02733866n: Blessings are the infusion or bestowal of something with holiness, spiritual redemption, divine will, or one's hope or approval.
A thing one is glad of.
Rite that should bring persons or property share in divine power or grace
A blessing is the infusion of something with holiness, spiritual redemption, divine will, or one's hope or approval.

bn:00413761n: A customary greeting from the Sanskrit for "bow, obesiance"
Namaste, sometimes expressed as Namaskar or Namaskaram, is a customary greeting when individuals meet or farewell.

bn:00005053n: The act of applauding; approbation and praise publicly expressed by the clapping of hands, stamping or tapping of the feet, acclamation, huzzas, or other means; marked commendation.
A demonstration of approval by clapping the hands together
A clap is the percussive sound made by striking together two flat surfaces, as in the body parts of humans or animals.
Praise or approval, expressed by clapping the hands.
Applause is primarily the expression of approval by the act of clapping, or striking the palms of the hands together, in order to create noise.

bn:00217786n: The high five is a hand gesture that occurs when two people simultaneously raise one hand each, about head-high, and push, slide, or slap the flat of their palm against the flat palm of the other person.

bn:00059529n: Prayer is an invocation or act that seeks to activate a rapport with a deity, an object of worship, or a spiritual entity through deliberate communication.

Prayer is the act of attempting to communicate, commonly with a sequence of words, with a deity or spirit for the purpose of worshipping, requesting guidance, requesting assistance, confessing sins, as an act of reparation or to express one's thoughts and emotions.
Invocation or act that seeks to activate a rapport with a deity

bn:00042676n: An exclamation used in songs of praise or thanksgiving to God.
A shout or song of praise to God
Hallelujah is a transliteration of the Hebrew word, which is composed of two elements: and.

bn:01193643n: The act of expressing approval or admiration; commendation; laudation.
Praise is the act of making positive statements about a person, object or idea, either in public or privately.
